p: According to several researchers [ 79, 80], β-caryophyllene also exerts potent anti-inflammatory activity in vivo, via decreasing the levels of TNF-α, TLR-4, and IL-1ß. Using a rat model, Abbas et al. [ 80] showed that β-caryophyllene induced apoptosis in luminal epithelium of the ovarian endometriomas and in endothelial cells. In addition, this phytochemical decreased the growth of endometriotic foci by more than 52.5% in comparison to controls. β-caryophyllene is also able to modulate the level of oxidative stress. It restores antioxidant enzymes and represses glutathione (GSH) depletion and lipid peroxidation [ 81].
